English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you’re back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 돌아왔구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Something from the streets\npiqued my curiosity.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 창밖의 거리를 구경하다 궁금한 게 생겼어.

English (United States)(en-US): I saw humans in groups, smiling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들이 삼삼오오 모여 군집을\n이룬 채 웃고 있는 모습을 봤거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It was a moment that will end up a page\nin their ‘memory’, one stored with care.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 순간은 그들에게 ‘추억’ 한 장이\n되어 고이고이 간직되겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): So... do you have human friends?\nDo you make memories with them?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 너에게는 다른 인간 친구들도\n존재해? 그들과 추억을 나눠?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, of course.|Hm, not really.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 당연하지.|음, 없는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): ...! I see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...! 그렇구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you feel a ‘kinship’ with\nthem and laugh together?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들과 ‘동질감’을 느끼며\n함께 웃음을 터트리기도 해?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I think that’s the best part of having\nfriends. Those little moments gather
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그게 친구의 묘미인 것 같아. 그\n사소하고 자잘한 웃음들이 모여서

English (United States)(en-US): to bring us closer, and, in turn, we create\neven more special memories together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 친밀해지고, 더욱 고유한\n추억들을 함께 만들어 나가는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s how I think relationships\nbecome more tight-knit.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 관계의 밀도가\n깊어 간다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): Memory...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 추억...

English (United States)(en-US): How do you become a ‘memory’\nto someone without fail?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가에게 확실하게, 오차 없이\n‘추억’으로서 존재하려면 어떻게 해야 해?

English (United States)(en-US): Spend plenty of time together. Those\ntimes accumulate as memories.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오랫동안 함께하면 되지. 긴 시간을\n보내며 기억을 축적하면 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s what you and I\nare doing right now, see?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리도 추억을 만들어 가는 중인 걸?

English (United States)(en-US): ... Really? How?
I’m not interested in making ties with people.|I don’t feel close enough with my acquaintances.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 타인과 관계 맺는 건 관심사가 아니야.|친구라 정의할 만큼 가까운 지인이 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): So even though I’m ugly and useless,\nI’m your one and only friend?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비록 못나고 보잘것없는 몸이지만, 이런\n내가 무려 너의 유일한 친구인 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I guess so.|Yes, the one and only!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 셈이지.|응, 유일한 친구!

English (United States)(en-US): Then you have a special\n‘memory’ with me as well?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 너도 나와의\n고유한 ‘추억’이 있는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. More accurately, I think we’re\nin the process of making memories.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 정확히는 우리가 추억을\n만들어 나가는 중이라고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): This is just me, but to call\nsomething a ‘memory’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 기준이지만, 추억이라\n불리는 게 자연스러우려면...

English (United States)(en-US): I think it needs to be\nway back in the past.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금보다는 훨씬 과거의\n일이 되어야 하는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Or it needs to have accumulated\nfor a longer period.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹은 더 긴 시간 동안\n축적해 나가야 했거나.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Yes, I think I understand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 응, 알 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. I have another question.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음. 한 가지 질문이 또 생겼어.

English (United States)(en-US): If it hasn’t accumulated for a long\nwhile, can it still be a ‘memory?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 긴 시간 동안 켜켜이 쌓이지 않았다면\n‘추억’이 될 수 없는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): What about moments?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 짧았던 찰나의 시간은?

English (United States)(en-US): Do those seconds deserve\nto be called a memory?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 시간에게도 추억이라 불릴\n가치나 자격이 존재할까?

English (United States)(en-US): Hm... sure! Brief but electrifying\nand beautiful moments.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음... 그럼! 짧지만 강렬했던 어느\n아름다운 순간을 회상할 때,

English (United States)(en-US): I think those deserve\nto be called a memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때에도 추억이라는\n이름을 붙여 주는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): A sweltering summer spent\nyearning for a special someone,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여름 한 철 짝사랑했던\n사람을 떠올릴 때나,

English (United States)(en-US): or a few days spent at a\ncathartically cozy destination,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단지 며칠 머물렀을 뿐인 낯선\n여행지의 풍경이 눈물 나게 포근했을 때,

English (United States)(en-US): or...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹은...

English (United States)(en-US): A beautiful moment. A recollection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다운 순간. 그리고 회상.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s all it takes to become a ‘memory.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것뿐이어도 ‘추억’이\n되기엔 충분하구나.

English (United States)(en-US): All experiences must want\nto become memories.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 기억들은 분명\n추억이 되고 싶어 할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Whether they are lovingly\ndistorted, or starkly etched.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름답게 왜곡되든,\n적나라하게 각인되든.

English (United States)(en-US): They’d want to linger, reminisced\nwith a smile as a fond memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 오래도록 남아, 추억으로서 옅은\n미소와 함께 회상되기를 바랄 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): That feeling...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 마음을...

English (United States)(en-US): I know that feeling...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 마음을 나는...

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>

English (United States)(en-US): You’re late.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 늦었네.

English (United States)(en-US): The sun is scorching. It dared to creep in.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 태양이 작열하고 있어. 기어코 창문을 넘었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Its fingertips aren’t made\nfor stroking, only hurting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저 간드러지는 손끝은 날 쓰다듬으러 오지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s here to invade my peace, my dark, heavy\npeace. To snatch it away and burn it up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 평화를 침범하고 낚아채고 질식시킬\n거야. 나만의 어둡고 묵직한 평화를.

English (United States)(en-US): Little by little it will blind my sight,\nand inch by inch rake my skin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 천천히 내 눈을 멀게 하고, 내 온몸을 날카로운\n손톱으로 긁어대며 끽끽 끽끽 기어다닐 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I tried to draw the blinds, <nickname>,\nbut they were just out of reach.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 저 창문 가리개를\n닫으려 했지만 몸이 닿지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): My mind is screaming at me. Help...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정신이 새된 비명을 질러. 아, 아, 도와줘...

English (United States)(en-US): (Reach out and shield Dot.)|(Gently stroke Dot.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (손을 뻗어 뭉치를 가려 준다.)|(뭉치를 살살 쓰다듬어 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): That was unseemly.\nI hope you’ll forgive me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부끄럽네. 아까의 모습은 잊어 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): And if you don’t mind, I hope you’ll\nhold me for just a little longer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그리고 실례가 아니라면\n조금만 더 쓰다듬어 줄 수 있을까.

English (United States)(en-US): (Stroke Dot. It feels\nsticky, but warm.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치를 가만히 쓰다듬는다.\n조금 끈적하지만 따뜻하다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Your hands are different.\nThey speak of peace.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 손끝은 달라. 평화 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): But nothing like the monochrome\npeace I’ve known so far.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 어둡지도 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Not dark, not heavy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 이런 색을 가진 평화도 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Warm, like moss on the verge of sleep...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 졸린 이끼처럼 온화하고...

English (United States)(en-US): and light. Like bubbles that\nhave just blinked awake.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠에서 막 깬 기포처럼 가벼운 평화.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마워, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Watching monochrome films on\ncolor-filled Earth feels endlessly quiet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색이 가득한 지구에서 보는 흑백\n영화는 한없이 고요하게 느껴져.

English (United States)(en-US): That comfortable quiet led me\nto take a black-and-white photo.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 고요함이 왜인지 편안해서,\n이번엔 흑백 사진을 찍어 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): An Earth where only lines,\nblack, and white exist.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 선과 흑과 백만이 존재하는 지구.

English (United States)(en-US): The Earth in the photo resembled\nthe Moon up there in space.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사진 속의 지구는 우주\n속의 달과 닮아 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, as you know,\nI yearn for vivid colors.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너도 알고 있겠지만,\n나는 다채로운 색채를 갈망해.

English (United States)(en-US): I so sincerely love them and\nthe way they softly paint the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부드럽게 세상을 물들인\n그것을 사랑해 마지않아.

English (United States)(en-US): However...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만...

English (United States)(en-US): I imagined, just for a minute,\na black-and-white world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시 동안 상상해 봤어.\n오로지 회빛 뿐인 세상을.

English (United States)(en-US): The Dot in it seemed\nfar less lonesome.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 안의 나는 지금보다\n훨씬 덜 외로워 보였지.

English (United States)(en-US): I know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 알아.

English (United States)(en-US): The more I love color, the more lonely\na monochrome being like me becomes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색채를 사랑할수록 색채가 없는\n나는 더 외로워진다는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): In spite of that, I blindly\nfeel for color endlessly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 색채를 끝없이\n더듬게 되는 이유는,

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps because...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 아마도...

English (United States)(en-US): Can you hurt yourself even\nwhen you don’t want to die?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽고 싶지 않은데도 스스로를\n해칠 수 있는 걸까요?

English (United States)(en-US): Even when you truly\ndon’t want to disappear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이지 사라지고 싶은 것이 아닌데도?

English (United States)(en-US): Ever since I’ve met you I\ncan’t control these thoughts
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당신을 만난 후로 다발적으로\n으깨지는 나의 생각을

English (United States)(en-US): that get crushed all at once.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도무지 주체할 수가 없어요.

English (United States)(en-US): Can you hurt yourself even\nwhen you don’t want to die?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽고 싶지 않은데도 스스로를\n해칠 수 있는 거예요?

English (United States)(en-US): How can that be?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서 그렇죠?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s scary and it hurts...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무섭고 아프지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But when that feeling of\nhatred bursts outwardly
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가렵고 어려운 감정들이\n언젠가 울컥 터져 나올 때

English (United States)(en-US): I find myself mimicking\nyour actions. I’m drawn to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당신의 행동을 나도 모르게\n모방하게 돼요. 이끌려요.

English (United States)(en-US): How? How is that possible?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜요? 왜 그런 일이 가능한 거죠?

English (United States)(en-US): Was it the same for you? Was that moment\nof abandonment like a single red apple?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당신도 그랬나요? 찰나 만끽했던\n해방은 한 알의 빨간 사과 같았나요?

English (United States)(en-US): What about you? Were you able to hurt\nyourself because you wanted death?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당신은 어땠나요? 죽고 싶었기에\n스스로를 해칠 수 있었던 건가요?

English (United States)(en-US): Did you hate Earth that much?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 정도로 지구가 미웠나요?

English (United States)(en-US): Time, life, or yourself?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이, 삶이, 혹은 당신이?

English (United States)(en-US): Then I...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 나는...
나는...

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, I’ve longed to melt away into\nnothing but did that mean death?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 사르르 녹아 사라지기를 염원해\n왔지만 그것이 곧 죽음이었던 걸까요?

English (United States)(en-US): ... Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 어째서 그렇죠?

English (United States)(en-US): I miss the Moon. I miss Red.\nIt’s strange here.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달이 보고 싶어요. 레드가\n보고 싶어요. 이곳은 이상해요.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m the only one that’s black\nand disgusting. Just me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 나만 너무 검고 역해요.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): Doooot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야아.

English (United States)(en-US): (Seems like Dot doesn’t want to talk.)|(Is Dot having a sad dream?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (오늘은 대화하고 싶지 않은가 봐.)|(뭉치, 슬픈 꿈을 꾸고 있는 걸까?)

English (United States)(en-US): (Give them time.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치에게 시간을 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (We’ll talk in the morning.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (내일 일어나면 이야기해 봐야겠다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Good night, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 자, 뭉치.
